public class Maze
extends java.lang.Object
implements NetEntity

Creates a random maze.

isWallUp

public boolean isWallUp(int x,
                        int y,
                        int dir)
Checks to see if a specific wall is currently up.

Parameters:
x - the x location of the cell you want to check
y - the y location of the cell you want to check
dir - which wall you want to check in the specified wall.
Returns:
true if the wall is up, false if the wall is down

generate

public void generate()
Generates a new maze.

getMazeData

public byte[][] getMazeData()
Returns maze data as a 2d byte array. Cells are serialized by a byte, using individuals bits as a flag. 0001 = north wall 0010 = east wall 0100 = south wall 1000 = west wall

generate

public void generate(byte[][] cellArray)
Builds a maze from a 2d byte buffer.

deleteRandomWalls

public void deleteRandomWalls(float percent)
Deletes a random walls. The number of walls is determined by a float percent between 0 and 1

print

public void print()
Debug print of the maze. Shows which cells have been visited during maze creation

Description copied from interface: NetEntity

receiveData

public void receiveData(java.nio.ByteBuffer bb)
Description copied from interface: NetEntity
Method used to reconstruct this object from the network. This method is called in NetHandler, and is used to update this object. Again, uses a ByteBuffer to encapsulate the data.
